channel.title: Claim Cheatsheet (FoL/FM)
channel.description:
**Hello! Have you ever wanted to make a sheet of player’s claims, but not had a clean, neat way of organising it? Well, look no further!** _____
>* **Player Name -** Class Claim > * * **Confirmed?** (how they are confirmed, if so) > ___
**Pretty neat, huh? Copy the following to get this;**
>* **Player Name -** Class Claim >* * **Confirmed?** (how they are confirmed, if so) > ___
**There are a few other things you can do to colour code it, or symbolise claims.**
[color=steblue]**Blue Dragon**[/color] - The main faction. **Steblue** colour. [color=purple]**Unseen**[/color] - One of the antagonistic factions. **Purple** colour. [color=darkred]**Cult**[/color] - One of the antagonistic factions. **Darkred** colour. [color=gray]**Neutral**[/color] - Neutral classes. **Gray** colour. ___ :drop_of_blood: **Royal Blood -** [color=steblue]**Drunk**[/color]/[color=purple]**Alcoholic**[/color], [color=steblue]**Noble**[/color]/[color=purple]**Aristocrat**[/color], [color=steblue]**Princess**[/color]/[color=purple]**Duchess**[/color], [color=steblue]**Prince**[/color] or **King.** :crown: **King -** The Player that is **King.**
:mag: **Investigative Class -** Investigative class can investigate others, revealing clues about their class, faction or type. :dagger: **Killer Class -** Killer classes can have an ability that allows them to kill, and they use this to advance their goals. :candle: **Offensive Class -** Offensive classes can use offensive abilities and techniques to disrupt foes, including occupation and target changing. :left_speech_bubble: **Social Class -** Social classes use abilities to either better communicate with other players or to alter voting. :star_and_crescent: **Special Class -** Some classes are one-of-a kind. These classes don't fill in on other type. :syringe: **Support Class -** Support classes aid and defend others by healing or empowering other classes

item.title: Claim Cheatsheet (FoL/FM)
item.dc:creator: Magnus
item.description:
An example of how this may look in game;

  • Magnus - Good King
    • Confirmed (via Guard)
  • Julian - Sheriff
    • Confirmed (via Check)
  • Beetee - Cult Leader
    • Unconfirmed (no room for otherwise)

Be creative in your formatting!

Read full topic

item.title: Claim Cheatsheet (FoL/FM)
item.dc:creator: Magnus
item.description:
Hello! Have you ever wanted to make a sheet of player’s claims, but not had a clean, neat way of organising it? Well, look no further!

  • Player Name - Class Claim
    • Confirmed? (how they are confirmed, if so)

Pretty neat, huh? Copy the following to get this;

>* **Player Name -** Class Claim
>* * **Confirmed?** (how they are confirmed, if so)
> ___

There are a few other things you can do to colour code it, or symbolise claims.

Blue Dragon - The main faction. Steblue colour.
Unseen - One of the antagonistic factions. Purple colour.
Cult - One of the antagonistic factions. Darkred colour.
Neutral - Neutral classes. Gray colour.

Royal Blood - Drunk/Alcoholic, Noble/Aristocrat, Princess/Duchess, Prince or King.
King - The Player that is King.

Investigative Class - Investigative class can investigate others, revealing clues about their class, faction or type.
Killer Class - Killer classes can have an ability that allows them to kill, and they use this to advance their goals.
Offensive Class - Offensive classes can use offensive abilities and techniques to disrupt foes, including occupation and target changing.
Social Class - Social classes use abilities to either better communicate with other players or to alter voting.
Special Class - Some classes are one-of-a kind. These classes don’t fill in on other type.
Support Class - Support classes aid and defend others by healing or empowering other classes

Read full topic
